title: Kate smacks cricket ball during match with Wills in Pakistan
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Prince William and Kate showed off their sporting abilities today as they joined a game of cricket in Lahore, Pakistan.

The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge took turns hitting soft balls with a group of children during their visit to the National Cricket Academy.

Competing against each other, William managed to hit a six, while Kate was caught out twice after half a dozen balls.

The duchess told the children she also liked tennis and swimming as well as being a cricket fan, as William admitted he had not played the sport since school.

Both the Royal couple appeared to thoroughly enjoy the game and dished out high-fives to boys and girls on the pitch afterwards.

Kate and William got stuck into the cricket match (Picture: Getty Images)

The duchess said she was a cricket fan (Picture: WireImage)

William said he hadn’t played cricket since school (Picture: PA)

The couple went head to head (Picture: Getty Images)

They met children from the National Cricket Academy (Picture: Getty Images)

It’s the fourth day of their Pakistan tour (Picture: Getty Images)

The children present are currently participating in the British Council’s Dosti programme, which promotes sport as a part of child development.

Kate and William also met former fast bowler for Pakistan, Waqar Younis, among other prominent cricketing figures.

Before leaving, they were presented with bats for their three children, Prince George, Princess Charlotte and Prince Louis.

Earlier today, the duke and duchess visited the SOS Children’s Village, which provides a home and family for 150 young orphans.

The couple attended a birthday party, in which Kate made her first Royal speech of Pakistan tour.

The couple were given bats for their three children (Picture: Getty Images)

Kate told the children she also liked swimming and tennis (Picture: PA)

She told the audience that they had reminded her and William ‘exactly what family means’, before finishing her address with some words in Urdu.

The duke and duchess were also pictured joining in with a story-telling session for the children, which required them to wear finger puppets.

Kate could be seen grinning as she and the children waggled their puppets together while a teacher played music on a guitar.

Later the couple visited Badshahi Mosque, set in the heart of the Walled City, where they took part in an inter-faith discussion with numerous faith leaders.

Princess Diana visited the site in 1991, and it was also included in the 2006 royal tour of Prince Charles and Camilla.

Kate went barefoot as the Royal couple headed to Badshahi Mosque (Picture: PA)

Both underwent an outfit change (Picture: Getty Images)

Kate made her first speech in Pakistan earlier today (Picture: PA)

The mosque is set in the heart of the Walled City (Picture: PA)

They will complete their day with a visit to the Shaukat Khanum Memorial Cancer Hospital and Research Centre (Picture: PA)

Kate changed into an emerald green headscarf with a matching shalwar kameez by Maheen Khan, while William sported a cream linen suit.

Advertisement

The duchess went inside the mosque barefoot, while William walked in his black socks.

William and Kate will finish their day with a visit to the Shaukat Khanum Memorial Cancer Hospital and Research Centre – also previously visited by the Princess of Wales.

The hospital was built by the now Pakistani Prime Minister, former cricketer Imran Khan, in memory of his late mother who died from cancer in 1985.
